sentences.english: Principle 1 - Don't criticize, condemn or complain.
We shouldn't blame, laugh at and envy anyone.
sentences.chinese: 我們不應責怪，笑和嫉妒任何人。

sentences.english: So, everyone. Please don’t be blaming porn on your relationship problems.
sentences.chinese: 因此，廣大羣衆，請不要因爲感情問題而責怪不雅物。

sentences.english: She could hardly blame the poor horse.
sentences.chinese: 她沒法去責怪可憐的馬兒。

sentences.english: He'd barely come home when he whaled into me for not writing to him.
sentences.chinese: 他一回家就責怪我不給他寫信。

sentences.english: " Some people blame him "not to take three feet of law, specifically human mind refers to the prison.
sentences.chinese: 有人責怪他“不循三尺法，專以人主意指爲獄”。

sentences.english: "You can't blame cheating on the Internet," Kholos Wysocki reasoned.
sentences.chinese: “你不能責怪互聯網上的欺騙，”威索基說道。

sentences.english: He reproached his son with laziness.
God chooses not to hold our sins against us.
sentences.chinese: 上帝選擇不因我們的罪而責怪我們。

sentences.english: The tone was bitter and accusatory.
sentences.chinese: 語調是埋怨責怪的那種。

sentences.english: "You can't blame cheating on the Internet, " Kholos Wysocki reasoned.
sentences.chinese: “你不能責怪互聯網上的欺騙，”威索基說道。

sentences.english: I could imagine that my old penholder feels reproachfully towards me.
sentences.chinese: 可以想象，那根老舊的筆架肯定在責怪我。

sentences.english: The LORD does not twit us with them and charge us with being insincere .
sentences.chinese: 上帝並沒有因我們的偏行己路而責怪我們不忠誠。

sentences.english: Mimi comfort lesser, grandpa will be fine, jingjing has been blame her.
sentences.chinese: 咪咪安慰小雅，爺爺不會有事，晶晶卻一直在責怪她。

sentences.english: Instead of the English, dont blame grace show, lai to eat snacks.
sentences.chinese: 世英出現，沒責怪恩秀，反而帶美萊喫零食。

sentences.english: The teacher admonished her about excessive noise.

definition: to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
guilty conscience/to feel a twinge of guilt
to understand/to pay attention to/to take notice of
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
to involve/to implicate sb/to spread to others (harm, trouble, damage etc)
